feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstipe CMS Stored XSS in custom meta tags
entry.content:
A malicious content author could create a custom meta tag and execute an arbitrary JavaScript payload. This would require convincing a legitimate user to access a page and enter a custom keyboard shortcut. This requires CMS access to exploit.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/cms/CVE-2022-37421.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/cve-2022-37421
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-37421
  • https://forum.silverstripe.org/c/releases
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/blog/tag/release
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pp74-g2q5-j4jf

entry.title: [silverstripe/framework] Silverstripe XSS in shortcodes
entry.content:
A malicious content author could add arbitrary attributes to HTML editor shortcodes which could be used to inject a JavaScript payload on the front end of the site. The shortcode providers that ship with Silverstripe CMS have been reviewed and attribute whitelists have been implemented where appropriate to negate this risk.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/assets/CVE-2022-38724.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/CVE-2022-38724.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/cve-2022-38724
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-38724
  • https://forum.silverstripe.org/c/releases
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/blog/tag/release
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9cx2-hj6m-fv58

entry.title: [silverstripe/framework] Silverstripe Framework SQLi Vulnerability
entry.content:
All versions of SilverStripe 3 prior to 3.6.7 and 3.7.3, and all versions of SilverStripe 4 prior to 4.0.7, 4.1.5, 4.2.4, and 4.3.1 allows Reflected SQL Injection through Form and DataObject.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-5715
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2018-021
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/issues/8814
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wvfw-w3x6-g526

entry.title: [silverstripe/framework] SilverStripe Priviledge escalation through cache pollution
entry.content:
In SilverStripe through 4.3.3, there is access escalation for CMS users with limited access through permission cache pollution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12617
  • https://forum.silverstripe.org/c/releases
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/blog/tag/release
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/CVE-2019-12617
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6r58-4xgr-gm6m

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] Cross-site Scripting in LibreNMS
entry.content:
LibreNMS through 21.10.2 allows XSS via a widget title.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-43324
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/commit/99d2462b80435b91a35236639b909eebee432126
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-46rx-6jg9-4fh8

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] Cross-site Scripting in LibreNMS
entry.content:
In LibreNMS < 21.3.0, a stored XSS vulnerability was identified in the API Access page due to insufficient sanitization of the $api->description variable. As a result, arbitrary Javascript code can get executed.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-31274
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/12739
  • https://community.librenms.org/t/vulnerability-report-cross-site-scripting-xss-in-the-api-access-page/15431
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2r2w-jrh2-p4gr

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] Cross-site Scripting in LibreNMS
entry.content:
LibreNMS 21.11.0 is affected by is affected by a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in includes/html/common/alert-log.inc.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44277
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/13554
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/13554/commits/fff7b45a7599f8f13a55250dc5f2b957f3394194
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4gwh-2pqx-f5cc

entry.title: [topthink/framework] Deserialization of Untrusted Data in topthink/framework
entry.content:
ThinkPHP v6.0.8 was discovered to contain a deserialization vulnerability via the component vendor\league\flysystem-cached-adapter\src\Storage\Adapter.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-36564
  • https://github.com/top-think/framework/issues/2559
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-33gc-6cw9-w3g4

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] Deserialization of Untrusted Data in librenms/librenms
entry.content:
Deserialization of Untrusted Data in GitHub repository librenms/librenms prior to 22.10.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-3525
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/commit/ae3925b09ad3c5d0f7a9d5a26ae2f2f778834948
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/ed048e8d-87af-440a-a91f-be1e65a40330
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cv9g-h8mm-xx5h

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CRLF Injection Vulnerability
entry.content:
CRLF injection vulnerability in phpMyAdmin before 2.6.4-pl4 allows remote attackers to conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via unspecified scripts.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2005-3621
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20060514052317/http://securitytracker.com/alerts/2005/Nov/1015213.html
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20061015000000*/http://www.novell.com/linux/security/advisories/2005_28_sr.html
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2006/dsa-1207
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security.php?issue=PMASA-2005-6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wj42-52pv-wfj2

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 6.0.0 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the Title parameter to htdocs/admin/menus/edit.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14241
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/d26b2a694de30f95e46ea54ea72cc54f0d38e548
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h3vg-4x76-v28w

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM Sensitive Data Disclosure
entry.content:
There is a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability in document.php in Dolibarr ERP/CRM version 6.0.0 via the file parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14240
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/d26b2a694de30f95e46ea54ea72cc54f0d38e548
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p9wf-x8h5-44fr

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] LibreNMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository librenms/librenms prior to 23.9.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-4982
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/commit/2c5960631c49f7414f61b6d4dcd305b07da05769
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/d3c2dd8a-883c-400e-a1a7-326c3fd37b9e
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6jj-fgmh-3p8r
